comments.body: There are several mods and steam, but it would be so much more convenient to use a in game controller support.

YES 

 

THIS IS NECESSARY FOR ACCESSIBILITY PURPOSES!

 

my autism makes it incredibly frustrating to switch from controller to keyboard....its like having to relearn how to play the same game over and over again and its a nightmare.

 

please fix this asap
so dumb, I wanna play minecraft with a controller on my MacBook, but MacBook only accepts java edition, and java edition doesn't support controllers... so frustrating

They definitely need to add controller support for Java, I'm honestly surprised they haven't already. It would be such an easy addition to make especially since they have already done it for the bedrock version on PC. Hopefully we can see this happen soon!

The background being in every menu is nice but I already get kinda dizzy by it always moving when trying to focus on the options due to having some slight issues with motion sickness (fortunately it's not that bad but I can imagine others have it way worse).

While it's nice to have it move in the main screen and I don't really want to fully turn it off it would be pretty nice if the background would just stop moving when going into the menus (or at least an option to stop it or revert to the dirt one be in the accessibility menu)

For me, the transparent background in the menu makes them feel too noisy and a bit distracting from an accessibility point. Even though the dirt background is in the resource pack, some players won't know unless they enable the pack. I feel like a button in the accessibility options to enable or disable the transparent background would be good.

The update is bad. The old UI with the dirt background was rlly good. There is the option to enable that back again, but that requires an extra resource pack to be enabled and when you're ingame and pause the game, the dirt background appears?!?
Revert these changes, no one likes that.

I personally don't really like this update. I have the feeling Minecraft Java is intentionally made more like bedrock edition every update. If you keep the changes, please at least add a setting to make this toggleable. Also, moving the button in the options screen to the very bottom feels unnecessary to me... 

 

The worst part of all ofcourse are the changes to the NBT system. This will break 99% of adventuremaps or other builds which use commands entirely. If you undo anything, please revoke the changes done to the NBT system.

This is a great idea.

Is it possible to incorporate this to the UI of the storage containers, also.

Also could the background tint be a bit darker, and the buttons be a bit wider to support longer texts in these buttons < for mods >

But aesthetically this is an improvement
üëÄ‚ú®
The Java UI is now starting to look like Bedrock!
The panorama shouldn‚Äôt blur when you access game options by default.

The new frosted glass blur layer is amazing, and gives every menu with it a beautiful new look! This new effect should definitely also be applied to other in-game menus for consistency. It currently feels a bit awkward to have the pause game menu use the new effect and then the inventory and other GUI screens just use the normal darken effect. It might be nice to see a mix between the two of these menu background effects, something a bit darker than current but keeping the beautiful blur effect, otherwise the GUIs can get a little bit drowned out when accessing menus during daytime in the Overworld.

The new End poem background is pretty, but a bit nauseating when trying to sit through and read the poem. It would be appreciated to have an accessibility feature to turn off or change the animated background to something that is more static.

Very interesting! GG!

However, there's something that could be improved in my opinion:

  • Like an existing mod does (Blur by Motschen), it would be interesting to see this blur, perhaps darker, even in regular containers to add an extra touch to the game. Also, I find it a bit annoying to see blurred slots, don't you think?

  • I would still add a themed background for when loading the Nether and the End, it would be more immersive!

I really like the new background blur, but there are some performance drops in the game because of it, only in the main menu it goes smoothly, when clicking on any menu button, the performance drops a lot, I am not against it, but I would like that the user can choose between the new and old GUI, not putting the old resource pack, because it breaks completely if you are using additional textures, also will make that a lot of people who do not have a dedicated graphics will not be able to continue playing the same way in the future.
think the dirt background should not be just available through programmer art, some people might want both the current art and the dirt background; perhaps a toggle?

- Switching between dimensions should display the animated nether portal (for the nether) and animated end portal (for the end).
- Can we get an update to the play screen like bedrock edition?
- Support for more fonts (NotoSans, Minecraft five or Minecraft ten)
- All the title should use the Minecraft ten font for easy receipt
- The GUI buttons, sliders, checkboxes should also be reworked after 15 years sticking with the old design

- Animations when switching between UIs, screens and elements (bedrock parity)

- Merging Worlds, Realms and Multiplayer into one play screen (bedrock parity) to navigate easier

- Ability to directly switching skins from the game
I think we forgot 24w08a

I love the new changes!

The only change I'd like to see to this is the game pause menu. It feels like that menu in particular should not be blurred. I like to be able to see things happening in the background through it, and I tend to pause the game quite a lot. I do like the blur everywhere else though, so I prefer not to turn it off.
The high contrast texture pack is not affected by most of the UI updates. Hopefully this is changed in the future.

I'm all for these new changes, and it's really modernizing the UI. I do think the dirt background should be accessible through a toggle instead of through programmer art, but asides from that these changes are great!

Overall I really like the new design, it looks a lot more modern and clean. The blur algorithm needs some improvements though - chat and other UI elements with finer details are looking really blocky.


However, the buttons now no longer fit in with the rest of the design. They look a bit out of place. As sad as I would be to see the old button textures go, I believe it might be time for new buttons, sliders and so on.
Just don't make them Bedrock-green, its too bright.

‚ÄúI think we forgot 24w08a‚Äù

There were technical issues releasing 24w08a, so 24w09a was released.
The option to blur the panorama when on the worlds, realms and friends screen should be added to Bedrock.
the blur algorithm could be improved, but a positive change overall

I like it overall. Feels fresh and better while still retaining Java edition's scrappy charm. I like the blur when on the main menu, but in-game it feels like a bit much at default settings (I turned it down to 25%). It would also be nice to be able to read chat somehow while paused while still having a "game paused" effect of some description.

The panorama also seems to freeze and jump a bit when loading into / out of worlds.
I like the old one better. I know you want new ideas and you worked hard on them but I personally don't like it. But i play 1.16 more than the newest version anyway so it does not effect me much.

This is an interesting change.

However, a button in 'Accessibility Settings' to bring back the dirt background would be useful. I believe it's not a big request, and it can help players that enjoyed the classic dirt background, just like there's Programmer Art for having old textures.
Using a resource pack to bring back the dirt background simply feels too inauthentic and clunky, and I'd have to constantly move around this resource pack between different installations, or may lose it accidentally, and so, an official solution (like that of the Programmer Art) would be appreciated.

I understand 'Panorama scroll speed' is an option, but currently, blur seems to be too bothersome for my liking as it's confusing to navigate menus with all of the semi-transparency. This option does indeed stop the panorama visibly scrolling in the back, but the fact that it's moving (by default) makes it really hard to focus on whatever I'm doing, and it's motion-sickening.

It feels as if there's little "depth" between the foreground and background, and the "solidity" of menus has been lost as a result.
It's difficult to immediately discern between a UI element and panorama visuals constantly being in the back.
It feels as if game's UI, and consequently the game, have lost what gave them the "Minecraft-y" feeling due to this "modernized" non-classic feel.

Please do consider making this an optional UI setting, or at the very least, allow an option for the classic dirt background.

Thank you.

The blur effect needs some improvement.
It creates a lot of noise by duplicating the elements.
The gaussian blur type would be more aesthetically pleasing.
Some menus, such as the datapack one, need a dark background filter or a content box to increase the contrast and make the texts easier to read.

I think the blur effect should use the Gaussian method instead of the Box one (I think that's the one that's currently being used), and if it's too computationally intensive it should switch to this method only under Fabolous graphics
looks very nice, although having an accessibility toggle is probably a good idea to avoid motion sickness and all that
I will miss the old school dirt background but hey new one looks cooler and smooth.

Feedback here is from the perspective of a Java player and resource pack artist who plays both Texture Update and Programmer Art styles:

Starting with great praise: The new UI is finally professional and I love how it looks with the current panorama (I anticipate 1.21's panorama). The blur filter not only looks good, but adds some awesome resource pack potential with the shaders (thank you for that!).

Next, my sole gripe: due to how you implemented the new textures, the background shows on packs like ProgArt and High Contrast even where they didn't before (such as right when you pause). This means that pausing in multiplayer immediately obstructs the action. I propose you have a separate texture for the in-game overlay, even if in practice it is identical to the in-menu texture so that there can be more flexibility in adding custom menu textures. Just two new files can significantly improve UI creativity and avoid reducing quality of life for ProgArt users.

Finally, something hopeful: the use of the portal shader for the credits background makes the credits look seamless with the portal which is really awesome and makes me extremely happy to look at. It could be cool to have the portal feeling by adding a ripple transition or something similar to still make it feel like you're going through that portal to somewhere (as ungracefully switching to a dirt background sort of did).

Overall, the update so far is exciting, and I hope tweaks like these can be added to make it stellar. <3

First of all. I really love the new UI, it just looks so much cleaner and better! But I think this UI for Java Edition should be a bit better

Small changes:

- Switching between dimensions should display the animated nether portal (for the nether) and animated end portal (for the end)

 

UI Updates:

- The GUI buttons, sliders, checkboxes should also be reworked after 15 years sticking with the old design. "Destructive/Delete/Remove" buttons should highlight in red color for easy recognition. "Recommended" buttons should highlight in green color so it forced the player to tap on that recommended option
- Merging World, Realms and Servers into one Play screen for easier navigation and they're divided by tabs. That's also mean the Multiplayer and Realms button on the main menu will be moved to the play screen. That will be much easier to navigate

- Inbox option on the main menu to stay up to date with latest snapshots and releases (bedrock parity)

- Animations when switching between UIs, screens and elements (bedrock parity)

- Support for more fonts [ (NotoSans (for description), Minecraft Five or Minecraft Ten(for title/headers) ] (bedrock parity)

  • All the title/header should use the Minecraft Ten font for easy recognition

Basically, the new menu's not bad. But why the "Blur" effect does not appear when interacting with chests or Furnace? Also very liked that at the end of the game, in the dialog changed the background.

Hello MOJANG. I didn't really like the change that replaced the background from the ground with a new one. Please add in the settings the ability to return the earthy background when entering the menu with worlds and creating a world. Thanks.

UI updates are good.
It is unnatural that the density of the menu screen and the black background of chests, inventory, etc. do not match.

request
„ÉªI would like to see support for chests, inventory, etc.
„ÉªI want an option to change the density of the black background (I want it to be completely transparent, 0%!)
„Éª Please fix the issue where the text scrolls when the setting item name is too long!

i use google translate

It seems like a good change to me, it looks with a more modern aesthetic and reminds me a little of the Minecraft Bedrock GUI. But poor performance, at least in the game menus.
I liked it, but it is poorly optimized, if they give me the choice between having that new GUI, but with lag in all the game menus, I would choose better not to have it and improve performance.

I would appreciate it or we would all appreciate it if you optimize it further. Thank you so much

  • My normal FPS: 30 - 32
  • My FPS with the new GUI: 5 - 12

The option to restore the old dirt background is a great idea, but I think it would be better to add a setting for that instead of a texture overlay.

That way it would be easier to disable the panorama background even if you change your resource packs to something else. Of course you can create an extra resource pack for this but that doesn't really solve the issue for me because:

In addition, the texture overlay also affects the in-game background, which seems wrong as the dirt background wasn't there in the old UI either.

Another problem I see with the overlay approach is that the panorama background affects my GPU usage a bit. When I have the game open, I have always left it in the multiplayer or single player menu to avoid the panorama being rendered.
In this snapshot, the panorama is still rendering behind the texture overlay, so there's no way to disable it.

So an actual setting instead of a texture overlay would be just perfect!

It's alright, but I still prefer the dirt background, or at least keep both and have the option to toggle which background you want, whether that be the dirt or the new one.

 

As I've played Bedrock more, the Bedrock edition is better and it's cool that they are both trying to come together with some of the same looks and features, but I feel like you should keep both the old and new, but have an option to prevent it from moving and the option to choose the old or new UI.
This is a great update! I really like the decision to use the colored background from the main menu instead of the dull earth texture. Especially when combined with the latest bg update (Sakura)
The interface update is pretty cool, but I would like you to add in the settings to change the transparent background to the old one or at least translucent (like in the mod Bedrockify)

The changes are amazing! Appreciate the work that's being done at Mojang.

One suggestion I have though is to add the functionality of the original Blur mod and have the blur gradually fade in and out instead of instantly going from one state to the other. Maybe also have a different setting for a blur in other container and inventory menus as well?
Some positive changes, however, the old button style now looks a bit out of place with the new background. So the buttons could possibly benefit from an aesthetic update too
I do like the changes but, I find it a little distracting. I may help to have the top and bottom darker than the middle in the Accessibility Settings; and other menus.

I was hoping I could use the high contrast pack and the transparent background at the same time, but the high contrast back just puts a black wall up, could there be an option to have both the transparent background and high contrast pack on at the same time?

1. Some users talked about seasickness caused by the constant twisting of the panorama. I didn't notice such a problem.
2.I think it would really be possible to add the ability to disable new tags, but I do not know how difficult it will be to do so.

3. It would be nice to add a soft appearance of bluer.

4. Also, if possible, it would be nice to have a bluer in the game interfaces (inventory, furnaces, storages).

5. I understand that No. 3 and No. 4 can be added using mods (for example, "Blur for fabric").

English is not my native language, my speech can be strange.

The new UI-blur should have a small fade-in effect.
We should also be able to customize the time via the Accessibility Settings for the blur effect to be fully "blured".

This blured background with the fade-in effect should also be in every UI's background because at the moment things like chests and the crafting table UI's do not have the new blur effect.

Overall the new Blur and UI-look is awesome!
Things like this make the game seem more modern and I really like it.
I think its cool but add button switch new menu and old.It great compromise

For those of us who have been playing for a very very long time this is a very weird change, given there's no option to have the dirt background unless you use programmer art which gives you all the old textures. I read several good comments on youtube talking about the importance of having the dirt block, especially for The End screen; i feel like the dirt background just made sense. Dirt is one of the first thing you see and use. When you beat the ender dragon, the end credits are talking about 'how far you have come'. A dirt background felt right as it connected you back to the start, the dirt block.
Update please now

The old dirt background should be toggleable with a setting and not be forced to use the programmer art pack with all of the old textures. Also, the End's void texture would be a better end-themed fit for the end poem background while not being nauseating and/or hard to read with the blue and green text.

I think the new UI looks good but, It's a little too transparent. With the added motion in the background it makes it more difficult to focus on the buttons. Even in the end game poem is a bit more difficult to read. I also think that the exit menu look better with less blur. The default setting should be at 10%.

    The dirt background may have been boring to some people but it didn't distract from what you were trying the do. So if you are to move forward with this new UI there should be a toggle button for the dirt background instead of having it with the in game classic textures.

Really good update! Even tho i would suggest something:

The border-box blur is less laggy, but i would make it so that when you enable Faboulous graphics, the blur would became Gaussian blur.

Also, i would recommend updating the buttons' size and texture, closer to the buttons from Bedrock Edition.

i[sic] feel like the dirt background just made sense. Dirt is one of the first thing you see and use. When you beat the ender dragon, the end credits are talking about 'how far you have come'. A dirt background felt right as it connected you back to the start, the dirt block.

This is true, actually. As much as I love the transition with the end screen, it feels more meaningful to have the cut and see the dirt. I think it could be really cool if you force the shader to make all the particles scatter from the center of the screen, and then have the background colour fade into the dirt (and the current dirt texture, not the old one). You still get the smooth jumping-into-the-portal effect, but then the dirt brings you full circle. I sincerely hope this is considered!

The dirt.png menu background gives Minecraft a familiar look that stands out from the crowd. I understand that the devs want to modernize it, but I think the blurred background makes the pixel text look out of place. And I'm pretty sure that if you want to keep the dirt background, you have to also have all the old textures enabled. I think it would be fine if y'all made the default background dirt.png but added an option in the menu to make it transparent for those who like it that way. Thanks for reading üòé

i[sic] feel like the dirt background just made sense. Dirt is one of the first thing you see and use. When you beat the ender dragon, the end credits are talking about 'how far you have come'. A dirt background felt right as it connected you back to the start, the dirt block.

This is true, actually. As much as I love the transition with the end screen, it feels more meaningful to have the cut and see the dirt. I think it could be really cool if you force the shader to make all the particles scatter from the center of the screen, and then have the background colour fade into the dirt (and the current dirt texture, not the old one). You still get the smooth jumping-into-the-portal effect, but then the dirt brings you full circle. I sincerely hope this is considered!

I completely agree with this. Minecraft has some things that just shouldn't be changed for cosmetic purposes. Same with a lot of things in the game, actually.

I feel like the end credits background works well as dirt.

The following is about Bedrock. I know this is a java snapshot, but with parity, you wouldn't have the end credits differ between editions.
In Bedrock edition, that background means you've taken a portal back to the overworld (dirt is used as the loading background for entering the overworld through a portal, like netherrack for the nether or endstone for the end) It's a nice subtle way to hint to the player that they're returning to the world when the credits are done!

I think the new command changes are lame. Please revert, or make it easier to add NBT data. It complicated the hell out of everything and now I'm frustrated and probably going to re-drop the game for a while.

I greatly dislike this new feature. I liked how plain and nondescript the dirt background was - this new one is way to busy, and the central bit just looks weird instead of being a distinct section like the old one. I also miss the dirt when changing dimensions - it provided a nice distinct transition in a nice muted colour.

Programmer art is certainly not the solution, as it contains other changes that I do not want (like old netherrack). (It also didn't actually work when I tried it, but I acknowledge that's probably a bug.)

Instead, a suggested solution could be to add a toggle to the video settings options - dirt background or new.

I really like this change! However, I've been working on an UI resource pack for Minecraft for some time now and there is a small problem. Enderchest and barrel use the same texture as the normal chests. I would like them to have their own UI texture, like the Shulker Chest. These currently all use the "generic_54" texture, which could then be renamed to "chest" as it is only used by chests, double chests, redstone chests, chests in boats and minecarts. This would allow Resourcepacks devs to create a custom UI texture for Ender Chest and Barrel without them always using the same texture as the normal chests.
I would be really happy if this would become a feature of Minecraft in the near future :)

Honestly I hate all the new changes. I want proper buttons and options to bring back the dirt background and screen darkening when pausing. It's only on the programmer art pack which is a really lazy and bad way to integrate it. Also when loading into and exiting a world, the dirt background will disappear for a little and show the blurred panorama so it doesn't even work right. Add a "old menu background" option that makes it just like it used to be where you don't see the panorama at all unless you're in the main menu screen.

Also, for the first time, there is now lag in the Java menu. It used to be that there would be like a few frames of lag when first booting up the game and then it would be perfectly smooth and lag free. Now that the panorama is visible, there's lag when clicking create new world or loading in or exiting or doing most things. Great parity feature, we now have Bedrock's laggy menus lol

The new changes are fine for those that like it, just have proper options to change back the dirt background and screen darkening. Please I don't want to learn to mod just for this xD It never hurts to just add options
Yo no lo puedo actualizar
i mean cool, new transperancy but maybe don't put the old background behind the programmer art resource pack and put it in accessability
I hate the blur; it's too laggy.
There's no subtitle in Bedrock? That's terrible, subtitles should be standard.
I saw that they've been adding more accessibility features, it would be perfect if they could at least add subtitles.
Recently switched from java to bedrock, and I'm incredibly disappointed in the lack of captions/subtitles.  I know it probably isn't ADA required, but I wish they would recognize this issue.
I cannot move to non Java editions of minecraft for exactly this reason- subtitles are vital to my ability to play and enjoy the game!

4 years later and subtitles have still yet to be added to bedrock... I recently started playing bedrock again after a few years, I have sensitive ears so I usually turn the sounds down but turn on subtitles so I can play my favorite game while also not overwhelming myself. I mainly play Java but I started out on mcpe at the age of 11 and I fell in love with it. I was happy to see that when I first got java Minecraft that it had them and I thought bedrock would also have it too and it was just added since I last played on mcpe. But I was wrong, it doesn't. I thought maybe it would come soon, so I waited; and waited, and waited and waited some more but still nothing nor any update on adding them or a reason as to why they can't.
It sounds great in theory but I get the feeling a phone couldn't handle it.
I really want to play with rtx on Android and wanted there to be physics with rtx Ive always want to do rtx on mobile please add thisüò¢üò¢üò¢üò¢üò¢üò¢
I can‚Äôt play MineCraft in my iOS anymore but there‚Äôs no ray tracing
Yes. This would make minecraft pe more better. If mojang would add this, pc players cannot bully us for our shaders. Thanks.

No you can't use ray tracing in 1GB ram phone. Cause ray tracing is not depends on the ram it depends on the processor. And there is only one processor which is capable with Ray Tracing. And the processor is MediaTek Dimensity 9000.and It's comes with Vivo X80.. which is a 8 GB ram Phone. So Mojang can't provide ray tracing in 1GB ram Phone.
I hope my phone cpu media tek g 90 can handle that
Im on a Chromebook and I honestly think that ray tracing & RTX would be the best for Minecraft bedrock

Even though the HUD doesn't go off-screen for me, I'd still like it to be a bit closer to the center. Not having to look all the way at the edge of the screen when checking my hotbar or potion effects would make the game more comfortable to play.
me too, this needs to be in settings, i can't see my souls or level bar unless my HUD is huge and still I can barely see them
If you mean for Bedrock this already exist :) you find it under Settings -> Video and scroll down to a button named "Change screen safe area"
my HUD is too close to the centere. i can change it on my ps4 settings but i can't have my gui small. in my videos i have to crop it to have my hotbar at the bottom
I‚Äôm on mobile and I messed up my screen safe zone and I can‚Äôt see the edges anymore.

Hello Mojang, the screen safe zone should be an adjustable setting in the video section. This would allow for the change to be temporary not permanent. Please remember that sometimes the players might set it too big and cant see their health and hunger, or it could be too close to the centre of the screen.

Seems that the screen safe zone used to be an adjustable setting in the video section. When I went to find this setting it was missing. (i am on xbox bedrock)
Amy chance this will he added back. Currently my wife cant see how many items she has with her UI.
on my iPad mini 6 the screen safe area box just never fits.
I have this problem for Mobile too, i‚Äôm on an iPad Pro and the screen safe area does not fit the corners of the screen.
This has been a problem for me for so long on ps4,playing the game with my safe zone far out I no longer enjoy playing the game I can‚Äôt see stat effects or most messages in the realms pack.

The only solution I‚Äôve found to fix the issue on mobile (I am on a 2021 12.9‚Äù iPad Pro) is to uninstall and reinstall the game. This will prompt you to adjust the screen border once you open the app for the first time after download. I made the border as small as possible. This made it so I can see everything (coordinates, chat, etc). Hope this helps!

I just got a new iPad and when this ‚ÄúSafe Area‚Äù thing showed up I exited out of my iPad for a moment and accident hit confirm. Now everything is weird when I play and I can‚Äôt fix this in settings.

I just got a new iPad and when this safe zone thing popped up I accidentally set it outside my screen and pressed confirm. Now, some buttons are only half on the screen and it‚Äôs hard to push them. I looked in setting and can‚Äôt find a way to change this. Also, the four corners don‚Äôt conform perfectly to the border of my screen.
I can‚Äôt tell what I‚Äôm reading sometimes bc mincraft goes off my screen, if y‚Äôall put a safe zone in mincraft it would be rly helpful not for just me for a lot of other people. Please

It‚Äôs not necessarily an issue about the screen safe zone, but would it be possible to have an option on the settings menu that allows you to change the‚Ä¶ shape of the screen? Minecraft takes up the whole screen of any device, but on the iPad Pro, the game looks like it‚Äôs being played on a square monitor with everything all packed into the middle. I was wondering if Minecraft could have an option of either having the game touch all the borders or having the natural rectangle shape that it has on PC, Xbox, and most mobile devices (that aren‚Äôt squares). Thank you so much and this game is absolutely amazing!

As it‚Äôs still not in options, here‚Äôs a workaround on iOS:
-Settings > General > iPhone Storage > Minecraft
- To the right of documents, click EDIT
- Delete options.txt
- Select DONE
The comment above me was right :) go to Iphone storage-> click on minecraft-> delete options.txt

on Ipad Air 2024 M2, IOS 17.5.1 there is no longer a Change Screen Safe Area in the video options.
Minecraft build Version: v1.20.81 Build 24130105.
The Top UI is miss aligned and haft off screen and cannot through any of the settings be re aligned.
There are multiple forum posts and reddit pages with the same issue across many versions all with comments and complaints that this is still unresolved for months if not years. Sort it out.

It's a still an issue for playing game with trigger buttons. When u put 2 trigger buttons to your smartphone u have to move some buttons(attack, sprint etc.) to the top of the screen, but because of the screen safe zone u can't.

Tried all settings like UI scale, different control layout but can't figure it out.

I like it! I like the back icon you made, and also enchanted neckwear could be a nifty addition to the game. Gloves & gauntlets should've been in awhile ago, 'cos we've been battling with unprotected arms since the Minecraft Epoch! Also they added the offhand slot, which is kind of awkwardly placed on its own. I'd like to see the rest of the row filled in :)

The backpack thing interests me. I don't see the need for inventory expansion (I think it's of a satisfactory size right now) BUT I do see a left-out explanation for why the player can hold 36 items. I've always imagined players wearing invisible backpacks. What I want to see is the 27-slot inventory done away with, then 4 tiers of backpacks which expand your inventory to the normal limit and beyond:

  • Tier 0 (No packpack): 9-slot hotbar only
  • Tier 1 (Wood Framed Pack): 9-slot hotbar + 9-slot inventory.
  • Tier 2 (Woolen Knapsack):  9-slot hotbar + 18-slot inventory
  • Tier 3 (Leather Backpack): 9-slot hotbar + 27-slot inventory
  • Tier 4 (Ender Bag): 9-slot hotbar + 36-slot inventory

Those materials 1-3 oughtn't be too hard to get. Plus when you die, all your stuff ought to remain bagged up inside the pack

It's severely uncanny how close your idea is to mine... as well as the arrangement of the slot items. 
Truly remarkable... alas, your usages of them are very severely limited and riddled with concepts that have already been denied.

I always though an new UI update would take the survival inventory UI and add tabs.  One tab would be your regular/main inventory.  The other tabs would be slots where you can link a shulker box or ender chest, as long as shulker is in your main inventory.  Just select any shulker tab in your inventory to have quick access to those shulker items.  These tabs would be like a pockets lined with your shulker box, and could access the contents of the shulker with out putting it down on the ground.

Lets say you have a shulker of different copper blocks and want to use a few of them.  If the shulker is in main inventory, you can assign it to a tab, select the tab, the contents of the shulker are displayed and accessible as if it were your inventory. If you then need some wood, just select that tab with the wood shulker box and you have access to all your wood with out moving inventory around.  When you are done with the shulkers, you just select your main inventory tab and everything is back to normal.

No extra inventory space is created here, just easier access to items in the shulkers so items don't have to be moved in and out of your main inventory when you are working with many different blocks and items.  They remain in the shulkers and you can just access them by changing tabs.

It seems my post was removed for being too similar to yours. Anyway, my idea was remove the current tabs and replace it with a sort of 'master' tab to allow for many more categories. This would almost eliminate the need for scrolling and mean most items are just clicks away. 'Survival Inventory' is moved next to 'Saved Toolbars' and 'Search', which stay the same.

How they are organised: https://imgur.com/a/DHMUauN

The blocks/items that don't fit on the first page are shown at the bottom. Transport and Tools stay the same. I didn't bother going through all the potions, arrows and spawn eggs. Same for Enchanted books so Combat just has the first page.

I'm new here so if someone know how to access my post that was removed (I really am having shocking luck with this) or contact Nova "inkycatz" Barlow then please help!

The Creative inventory of Bedrock is not only very organized, but also contains more slots to display more blocks at once. That one should be ported to Java Edition.

https://minecraft.gamepedia.com/File:BECreativeInventory.png

Even if they don't add a bunch of new categories or change how to get around, they really do need to organize it better.

I do think one new category would be good: Building stuff that isn't Normal Blocks. Things like stairs, slabs, and fences.

They should have all the would stairs together, followed by the stone stairs (including granite, diorite, and andesite) and then prismarine, etc. etc. Then we would have all the slabs, grouped roughly in that order, and then the walls, and then the fences and then the fence gates.

In the main blocks tab they should have all the wood, (planks, then logs, then stripped logs, then stripped wood) then the stone, then the dirts (like grass and mycelium, podzol, path, etc.), and then all the other categories and stuff.

And for goodness sake, why are the bookshelves and the walls not in the decoration tab? And seriously, the gates should be with the fences. I mean that's just common sense.

Anyway, that's just my thoughts on that.

For my idea on how to organize the Creative Mode Inventory:
There would be 10 Tabs;
Blocks,
Decor.,
Redstone,
Farming,
Resources,
Utilities,
Misc.,
Menus,
Toolbars,
Search,

Blocks would hold all of the Full Blocks that do not house any unique fiction and would be split along the types of blocks it holds.
Natural Blocks such as Dirt & Podzol at the top followed by the Stones, followed by Woods, and so on and so forth.
Decor. would hold all of the Plants, Workstations & related blocks such as Beehives & Enchantment Tables, the Mushrooms, Walls/Fences, ect.
Redstone would house the Redstone, Minecarts, & Rails.
Farming would hold the Foodstuffs, placable plant items such as Kelp, Bamboo, & Sugar Canes, as well as Seeds.
Resources would house the general junk only really found in crafting recipes and nothing else like sticks & Bones.
Utilities has all of the actually usable items such as saddles & boats, armour, weapons & tools, potions, enchantments, leads & horse armour, & things such as fireworks, buckets, & arrows.
Misc. holds pretty much everything that you can't get in survival.
Menus has every interface that isn't normally accessable without a block as well as your inventory.
Toolbars holds your saved hotbars.
Search is the same.

Yes. That‚Äôs a great idea. I have even more suggestions to improve it. (Bedrock edition)

  1. More character slots.
  2. Folders for your characters (for example: ropeplay)
  3. Maybe another emote slot. You could maybe tap/click the center wheel in a menu to access a second page. Tap again to go back.
  4. More cape options
  5. In classic skins, when you import from an image. If that image is a GIF, the skin would be animated. Minecraft would check each frame. If every frame is a valid skin image, then the skin would be animated.

 

Character Creator

  1. Option to have filters in the selection menu. They could be ‚Äúowned or unlock-able (achievements)‚Äù, ‚Äúnot owned‚Äù, ‚Äúfavorites‚Äù, ‚Äúmade by Minecraft‚Äù
  2. Favorites: when previewing an item, tap a star icon next to the zooming one. It‚Äôs gray-preview will have a star on it. You can also find it in the favorites filter.
  3. A button to make all of the ‚Äúnew‚Äù items that are bought have their green diamond removed as a way of saying you saw them.
  4. When previewing an item, an eye icon can be tapped to make everything on your character but the item you are previewing become transparent. This would be useful if you are making a character and it already has a lot of items on it and it may be hard to see your changes.
